website_summaries.verdict: While it compares favorably to other corded Remington models in terms of power, this model stands out for its longer reach, making it a good option for users with high branches.
pros: This pole saw can reach as high as 15-feet overhead for users who can control the saw at that distance, making it the best Remington model for very high cutting jobs
The 8-amp motor is surprisingly powerful, and handles small to medium-sized limbs or logs
The head detaches for use as a chainsaw
This model also includes a 10-inch extended chain and a comfort grip for easy maneuverability
cons: When fully extended, the saw becomes difficult to maneuver for those with limited upper body strength

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw/ pole saw
customer_reviews.text: Easy as pie to assemble and use. It is a little heavy on the pole end but I managed to run it for about 45 minutes non-stop (pretty good for a female). I really like the way you can easily convert from the pole extension to a hand held. It cut through everything I put it on. (cutting crape myrtles) Only con I found was with the operator running out of steam!!
customer_reviews.author: Jojo Willis

customer_reviews.title: i like the detachable hand held
customer_reviews.text: landscaper here. we use gas powered equipment for everything work related. i bought this for home. i like the detachable hand held, it has plenty of power, oiler works great. fairly lightweight to raise overhead. since i have power all over the acre this saw will work great for me. there are several features of this saw that were well thought out in the design. chain tensioner is one. angle of bar is another. footrest of saw when detached from pole is another. considering a gas power extended pole saw is $450 this is a score.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: ILL DESIGNED, TOO DAMM HEAVY AT THE BUSINESS END OR WORKING END OF THE SHAFT!
customer_reviews.text: Forget it... read my "Headline" only an inexperienced engineer/designer could have possibly configured this tool. IT'S TOO DAMM HEAVY ON THE BUSINESS/CUTTING END OF THE SHAFT, because of the weight of the motor on the cutting head end. The motor needs to be at the bottom of the shaft, where it would configured with a flex or solid drive shaft "only" up through the extension tube. In my opinion (only) looks good, but functionally when fully extended, only a behemoth of an operator, could possibly wrangle/control this poorly configured over weighted at the functional cutting end. The MOTOR IS TOO HEAVY... TOO PLACED AT THE TOP END OF THE SHAFT!!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Safer than using a ladder to prune.
customer_reviews.text: A neighbor loaned me his pole saw and it was so much safer than what I had been doing; reaching from the top of a step ladder to prune the tree. I ordered it for myself the very next day. I love it. I am able to walk around the tree and prune it without ever thinking about getting up on the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Widman

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: So far so good after a few days of heavy use. Chain appears sharp and cuts easily. I much prefer to use it as a small chain saw. It is pretty heavy extended fully on the pole. I was able to prune and fell a tree that was about 40ft tall. I did not intend to use it for such a big job but the larger Vera saw RM 1645 was broke right out of the box and this little saw came through for me.
customer_reviews.author: anthony jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this pole saw , comes off way too easy and very top-heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive this pole Saw. It is very top-heavy and hard to hold up when cutting branches. Although it cuts well the chain popped off by the third cut. And yes we did adjust the tension. My brother used it and found it very tiring on his arms because of the angle of Saw. Definitely a balance issue. We have spent way too much time putting the chain back on. Even when just using it off the pole. Sorry but I would not recommend this pole chainsaw
customer_reviews.author: Di Guild

customer_reviews.title: Chain would not stay on
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 15 minutes then chain came off and would not stay on. Chain became bent. Bought new chain and it worked well for 5 minutes before Chain started slipping again and could not keep it on. Yes I adjusted tension. Sent brackets to Amazon for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, low quality.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I might save some cash and this would get me through one project cutting low limbs—nope. First cut chain comes off and gets stuck within seconds. Tensioning was correct. I put it back on and again it throws the chain. Not that it moves that fast either. Even without that all the weight of the motor is at the end of the pole making the balance point on the wrong end. Could be used, but would fatigue fast. Bad design, bad quality. No shortcuts I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to change combination
customer_reviews.text: I put this pole saw combo to work right away. It can be a bit heavy as you extend it above your body but it did the job well. You just have to use common sense and not push your extension further than safe. I used the pole saw to cut overhead branches then easily converted it to the chain saw to cut the branches down. I am very pleased with the ease at which it converts from pole to saw. Also very pleased with how easily it breaks down for cleaning. I took other reviewers' advice on the chain saw oil and have not had a problem with leaking oil in storage. Very pleased with this chainsaw/pole saw combination...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Very useful tool. Cut tree trimming and pruning time dramatically. Built sturdy enough provided you do not abuse it by dropping it or throwing it around. Powerful enough to cut through 6 inch oak branches. Oil injector is easy to fill and works well keeping the chain lubricated. Not overly heavy, even with pole fully extended. Wish I had bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: jm7

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk - the chain constantly comes off. After using approx twice, the chain came off and I was unable to get it back on. A local power tool place indicated that the chan was damaged (with only light duty use). Had to buy a new chain.....which continually comes off. Had to hand oil chain as it doesn't seem to stay oiled. Do not waster your money on this.!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ober

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It's really easy to use and it cut pretty good but when it came to tighten the chain. I had some difficulty loosening the tention knob and had to use a rench to loosen it. Then the whole tension knob came apart and now I can't figure out how it goes back together. Update: had to order tension knob to replace the original one, chainsaw is heavy when the pole is attached and a bit difficult to handle. Best use without the pole, my thoughts on power of the chain saw are it could be more powerful but it gets the job done. Just don't like the way of tightening the chain.
customer_reviews.author: Raf

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as light - not for me or my wife
customer_reviews.text: First, assembly was deficult. Weight makes it hard to manipulate. I am over 70 years old, my wife is petit, and the "light weight" of this is unmanageable for us. As explained in the directions,the chain has fallen off during the initial uses. As a chain saw, without the pole, works well, and my sons, ages in 30s, can use the polesaw. IF THIS PRODUCT IS THE LIGHTEST POLE AVAILABLE, I WOULD HESITATE RECOMMENDING ONE FOR ELDERLY USERS. Because my sons can easily use the pole, I am keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Conroy

customer_reviews.title: It is what it claims to be
customer_reviews.text: All that I expected it to be. A little heavy on the extended pole but that can't be helped. If you need a chain saw for limited cleanup around the yard such as removing small limbs or trees or cutting smaller logs into firewood size this will do the job for you. Just realize that it's tied to availability of electric current.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it - nice features
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Well thought out design. The hook it a great idea - it gives you a place to rest the saw on a branch so you can rest your arms before you start using the saw. Using the saw, especially in the extended mode is physically demanding, they all are. The hook is a big deal. The no-tools feature is very nice. If you use a chain saw much you know what a pain it is to have to use a tool to adjust a chain. I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: John Stuckey

customer_reviews.title: Improvement over old model that was a fave already
customer_reviews.text: After 6+ years of use and abuse and excellent performance, my older Remington died. So far so good with this v2.0 of the pole saw - it's a beast! The new downward angle of the saw helps a lot and the chain oiling (which had been a problem in older versions) works extremely well with no leakage. Love the modular disconnect of the saw and power unit, very easy to switch as compared to other model. Only negative is that it is a bit heavier, but workable; you just have to be (more) careful not to over-reach when on a ladder, but you knew that, right?
customer_reviews.author: Tipps from the Tippster

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw, set up. Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Remington Ranger. The updates on the II are useful and make transitioning from saw to pole and back a snap. The saw itself remains mighty for a little saw. I often prefer to use my little electric ranger saws over my gas saw. The only reason I ordered this one is because my Ranger I pole broke (due to user error I suppose). My Ranger I gave me some good years, I anticipate my Ranger II will also after using it a couple times now. Worth noting, these saws are a bit top heavy when fully extended. I have no problem handling this but I could see where some could.
customer_reviews.author: Guinness

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this chainsaw. I have used it several times to trim trees and cut firewood. I have about 30 trees on my property, and it works great for trimming and cutting up the wood to be burned later. I don't have a problem with the weight, but you do need to plan your cut and understand what will happen once the limb is cut through. Working removing and adding the extension handle is easy. The saw works great as an extension or handheld chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mountain Biker

customer_reviews.title: Does work
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this. I purchased it in May of 2018 and it sat in my garage for a few years before I used it and it doesn’t work. I am so frustrated because I bought it and figured it would be ready for me when I needed it and it wasn’t. Forget calling the company you are prompted to use the system and can’t get a live person. Very frustrating and disappointing and I have to figure out who can fix the damn thing now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trees were cut down 15 minutes after FedEx dropped it off.
customer_reviews.text: Caveat: I've never used, let alone owned a chainsaw before. That said, this did everything I was expecting it to. It was easy to get working, and got the job done. I had a tree in my back yard that needed to go. I was able to cut the branches off and the trunk down in just a few minutes after opening the box. This would go through 5" trunks like a hot knife through butter. Yes, it's a little heavy when it's on the pole - and if I planned on using this thing every day I might want something more ergonomic. But for home use / this price it's perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul r

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trimmer / Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This unit work really well. Nice not to have to worry about Gas and the fumes that come along with most chain saws/ trimmers. Really like the fact you can use this a Chain saw. Only issue I had was that when you ad the extender pole this things become pretty heavy and when trying to cut high over head its a little bit of a challenge. Other than that I like this a lot and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard N

customer_reviews.title: Well made, Utilize branch hook to overcome its weight!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pole saw to replace my 8/9 years old RM1015p, this one got a few nice features (auto oiler/tension, no tools requires to remount-chain, etc.) over the older model, however, it's much heavier, unknown how much heavier, but felt substantial when I used it on an extension ladder. Update: I changed from 4* to 5* BC I know how to utilize its "Branch Hook" to hang around either ladder-steps or branches, won't need to carry it(save energy) til I'm ready to cut.
customer_reviews.author: JustinDad

customer_reviews.title: A Real Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: This has been the most useful item we have purchased for outdoor work and it has proven itself to be a true workhorse. We had several trees that we need to not only trim but to cut down. Our lawn man has been able to climb and cut trees that are over 50 feet tall with this little saw. It not only works to cut trees but is great in cutting off branches to make disposal easy. We have used the saw as a pole saw to trim some oaks tree limbs and it has made quick work even with this hardwood. Makes life easier in our yard.
customer_reviews.author: South Texas Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best $100 you could spend for the yard.
customer_reviews.text: It has done 1 hard days worth of work. I trimmed a tree with branches up to about 4inches thick. It was very convenient to use this in both configurations. My only complaint is that the bar came loose a couple of times, but seemed to stay tight after about the 3rd readjustment. I used a quality bar oil and it seemed to run for a decent amount of time without needing more. Small branches kick a bunch, so you may not want to use this to trim those down.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw is great for the purpose it was designed to do. it is also very versatile given that the extension pole is easy to remove and the saw can operate as a regular electric chain saw. For trimming with the extension pole you can't beat it. After trimming switch over to a regular electric chain saw and cut up what you have trimmed. If I had to say one negative it would be that the pole is fragile and can be damaged if it hits something or something falls on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Pasqual

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool and it's simple and quick to convert between a pole saw and a reg. electric chain saw. With a 10' pole, you need to really hang on if fully extended, not the lightest on the market but very durable. The best feature is the chain tentioner... no tools needed and works well. I went with this model as a med. weight but with superior cutting power and ease of adjustment over cheaper and lighter models. I'm really glad I did. BobM
customer_reviews.author: Robert Moncsko

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but heavy, cuts as stated, good performer.
customer_reviews.text: You really need strength to reach over-head and then squeeze, grip and cut limbs. Disappointed in the "length" of reach, because I can not reach high branches like I could with my 8" Remington, telescopic polesaw. This 10" saw does cut 4"-10" limbs well. The grip/guard/convert to hand-held cutting module works and feels good. The easy adjust chain ratchet makes adjustments convenient... NICE feature:)).
customer_reviews.author: brlum

customer_reviews.title: Cuts and cuts
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Cuts well, and you can change it from a chain saw to a pole saw in seconds. I've had no problem with it leaking oil. When fully extended, it can be a bit heavy. I'm a good size man, and it still takes strength to hold it and get it in the right position. It has a holder for the wire that keeps it from unplugging. Super easy to use, and plenty of power. Great addition to my tool shed. I love that it plugs in and I don't have to try to get the engine to run.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Cut down alot of overgrown, bushes and trees, with trunks over 6". Somewhat top heavy but that's expected. Tension adjustment is relatively easy, doesn't leak oil. Overall very pleased so far. I do recommend !!! With the 10" blade you can cut a 1' in diameter branch with proper care, be safe about it
customer_reviews.author: FROMAN

customer_reviews.title: Heavy at full extension
customer_reviews.text: This saw cuts like crazy. Really need to check the chain tension after every cut in the beginning. Get familiar with tightening...it's pretty simple. This one does leak oil when sitting. I ran it out pretty low then set it in a carboard box until it stopped. If you take the saw handle off the head it all fits in a box. Ran it on a 100ft extension cord just fine. Just stand the pole in a corner.
customer_reviews.author: oldmutt

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power but be prepared for a good upper-body workout
customer_reviews.text: Quick change from pole saw to standalone chainsaw, just seconds. Plenty of power but be prepared for a good upper-body workout. It's a serious exercise maneuvering this overhead, particularly if nearly fully extended.
customer_reviews.author: Gatorguy

customer_reviews.title: This saw works like a pro
customer_reviews.text: As stated in other reviews this saw is heavy but you can't build a pole saw this tough without it having some weight to it. My last Remington pole saw was somewhat lighter and it lasted many years but this one is so heavy duty that is will most likely last me a lifetime, the build quality of this saw is very close to what you would expect to find in a commercial saw. Yes it's heavy but if you know how to use a pole saw it's very manageable and built to last, I highly recommend this product if you are looking for a well built get the job done pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Stewart/Timeless Iron Forge

customer_reviews.title: My first chainsaw and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to switch between polesaw and chainsaw. With a couple quick buttons pushes and changing where the blade/motor is connected your ready to go. Easy to see how much bar/chain oil with the opaque level display. Very easy to adjust the chain tension. Cuts great, runs pretty quiet, and does what it needs to do. Now it can be a little cumbersome to use when extended due to the weight. Also you have to watch out where your plugged in cord is to not trip or cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: A bit heavy, but strong and versatile. Great design.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this an overall 5 stars because it IS a great product in getting the job it's designed to do - done! I have to agree with other reviews in that it is heavy, especially when fully extended, but not overwhelmingly difficult to maneuver, especially after you get it vertical. Good reach, and a beefy locking pole. Especially happy about the versatlilty of converting it to a standard chain saw with just some simple clicks.
customer_reviews.author: MYD

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: While the extension rod is long compared to many others and the saw is well built and sturdy, its a heavy unit. When fully extended the saw/motor unit is like moving a balling ball at the end of the pole. It cuts and prunes great and I like the ability to detach the saw to use independent of the pole. I also like the ability to adjust the length of the pole to suit the job.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this saw
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw! Easy to use and it cuts like a champ. Only complaint is it could use some type of shoulder harness for extra support. It tends to get heavy after extended use. I tried looking for one but I was able to find one. Other than that it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plugged the saw up right out of the box and it did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked the saw and assembled it. Was anxious to start trimming limbs and pulled the trigger and nothing. Checked my extension cord to make sure it was working and it was, checked everything and still nothing. Packed the piece of junk up and will be sending it back today.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: I gave it to a friend and he said it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Well, right after I got this chainsaw I had all the trees on my property cut back by a professional landscaper, so I was left with no use for this chainsaw, so I gave it to a friend. He just called me today raving about how easy it is to use and capable (and rather heavy when fully extended). He said it cut through an 8 inch White Birch tree with no problem. I'm really glad I gave it to him.
customer_reviews.author: lighten_up_alreadyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Use some channel lock (grrove joint) pliers tighten chain.
customer_reviews.text: You need to improvise with tools to get the chain on tight enough so the saw doesn't "throw" the chain. Other than that its a good electric pole saw. Manual sez its a tool less process...not true. You will need to use channel lock pliers to twist the "ring nut" to get some extra cranking leverage so the chain doesn't constantly fall off. Bare hands won't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Broganator

customer_reviews.title: It's long but it's heavy
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because it has the longest length of any electric pole saws. It's 10 feet long. But the longer you make them the more important it is to keep the weight of the item at the end of the pole (the saw) low. This saw is not low weight (and I perform weight lifting every week for 37 years). Of course if you don't extend it all the way it's easier to use. It's a good saw. Remington should make an additional 12 foot long saw with say a 6 inch chain using the lightest materials.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gradilone

customer_reviews.title: I was impressed which is hard to do.....
customer_reviews.text: Very nice operating saw, extension is smooth and easy to adjust and lock chain. Easily cut 6" limbs, and smaller could possibly cut a bit larger. I will say it is a bit heavy, I'm 63 and did fine however getting on the ladder I had a young man accomplish.
customer_reviews.author: Markie

customer_reviews.title: Great lighweigh and capable
customer_reviews.text: Long extension relatively easy to extend, even when you r hanging on a tree. Uses quite some oil. In 20 min cutting, 1/4 of oil reservoir was used. Very easy to adjust chain even with gloves. Cap of reservoir is hooked to a wire. *****edit feb2019****** 5 months of intensive use. used the saw to make boards of hickory. still working strong after so much use. it s a courageous chainsaw. only had to sharpen the blades once so far. (hickory is hard and dulls blades).
customer_reviews.author: mosquito lamp

customer_reviews.title: The chain falls off after every few cuts
customer_reviews.text: The bar keeps slipping back, making the chain lose all tension, and then falls off. This happens every two to three cuts and there is nothing I've been able to do to fix it. I'm going to be returning it now after about 20 minutes of actual use over 3 hours of time since I've had to mess with it so much to try to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Kramer

customer_reviews.title: VERY top heavy at end of pole
customer_reviews.text: Great saw and looked well made but gave it two stars for practicality. Put a HEAVY saw on the end of a pole and expend it ~8-9 feet. Try to control said saw at the end of said 8 foot pole. Not happening unless you bench 150 three days a week at the gym. The concept is great but there are other pruner says much lighter and manageable. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: This is a little  bundle of power. Works very. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a lady senior citizen, I bought this to help me in my yard. I'm a do it yourself person.This machine is GREAT. It cuts very well, especially with the extended length pole. It cut cleanly through the limbs of a nice size couple of trees. Make sure you order the lubricant oil with it. Happy over its performance.
customer_reviews.author: sandra C

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: This looked like the answer. Well, it might be for you young bucks out there, but a tad heavy for us old folks. the weight of the saw caused a bit of unsteadiness and wobbly legs and arms. Bummed we had to return it but no issues. Be warned but good luck if it's not an issue
customer_reviews.author: BusyNana

customer_reviews.title: Versatility and Quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price I'm very impressed with its versatility and how rugged it is. The length that it can extend to has allowed me to cut the branches a lot higher. Before I bought it I was reading some of the negative reviews and was a little concerned with the purchase. Once I used it I was surprised that anyone had problems at all. I'm very familiar with chainsaws and have cut down oaks as big as 4' across. This is a great product and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B55

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job trimming limbs.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. It is light weight. Just right for a 70 year old female to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never had the chance to try it out. Dead on Arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to have the change to cut back a few limbs that were in desperate need of trimming, however after I put the saw together, the saw did not work. Yes, i unlocked the trigger with the button, I even tested the cord that I was using, I tried with and without the pole without resolution, I called support and they told me to take it into a local shop, i considered it, but why the world start repairing something that should work out of the box, so I took it to UPS and sent it on back, i'll try a different brand and a different company next time.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron lilly

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: Handle portion is easily detachable and make a small liming saw with the use of the power head. Slightly awkward and heavy in the full extended position but manageable for someone in good physical condition. Works as advertised and the automatic chain oiler is a huge bonus, no more shutting down to manually oil the chain.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sutton

customer_reviews.title: It's a little heavy, but works splendidly!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the ease with which you can switch it from the pole to the hand-held version. It's rather heavy, but then I'm a 60 year old man that doesn't have the same strength as you young whippersnappers do! It cut really well, but do NOT neglect to get bar chain oil. There is a reservoir for it, but it's dry.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Clough Purchasing Agent, Advanced Precast Products

customer_reviews.title: way too heavy
customer_reviews.text: this pole saw is way too heavy to manage reaching limbs-- I cannot extend and reach --it will pull me right off the ladder..even from the ground its awkward --- and the handle is very much in the way to get a good grip--I would have returned it but missed the return window
customer_reviews.author: TKS

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy weight forward, women beware.
customer_reviews.text: For 100 bucks it works.. Husband is happy. It is weight forward so that makes it very difficult to use with out it falling to the ground after the cut. I will never use it, it is way to heavy furthest away from the body, hard to control, I may consider making a harness for it to keep control and keep the chain out of the dirt..
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: I had an older Remington Pole Saw which was perfect weight wise and the diameter of the pole was ...
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the four star rating was due to the weight. I had an older Remington Pole Saw which was perfect weight wise and the diameter of the pole was somewhat smaller. I do not have the dimensions available but the feel of the older saw was better. No complaints about the quality and cutting ability of the new Remington.
customer_reviews.author: Guy F. Pane

customer_reviews.title: Good pole saw for most tasks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to facilitate cleaning up a couple of trees on the property here in the city. Plenty of power, light enough, seems well built. The versatility of being able to use it as a chainsaw for cleanup is remarkable!
customer_reviews.author: M. Sink

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt Last
customer_reviews.text: Plenty power to cut but parts dont last. I used this thing 3 times before the main gear gave out. You may wonder why the chain does not stay on or it just "slips".here is the answer. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Was excited about getting an electric pole saw, excitement quickly faded when turning it on. You can not get the chain to stay on for more than 30 seconds. We tried at least twenty different chain tensions. Nothing helped. Chain, when trying to cut, would jump off bar as soon as you touched the limb. Either the unit was built with the wrong sprocket or the wrong chain.
customer_reviews.author: James Todd

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just make sure you have the strength to hold it when it is fully extended.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, heavy trimmer. I say that because when it is fully extended, it feels very heavy. With the weight at the cutting end, it takes some strength to hold it up. But it cuts great! And the detachable head connects to the handle to make a nice little chain saw to finish cutting up the limbs. You’ll get an arm workout, but it makes quick work of any limb you want gone.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome saw! Yes it’s a bit heavy but all saws are on the end of a pole. The weight is good for me. I love this saw. It cuts down some big trees with no issues. Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Scott carden

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one time use
customer_reviews.text: It broke after only one time use and not getting any help from the manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: Peter Babaian

customer_reviews.title: The chain will not stay on!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw to trim a few trees and that's is about it. I even went and purchased another chain still the same problem. when you cut one branch you have to put the chain back on!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chain wouldn't stay on
customer_reviews.text: It was great when it worked. The chain would never stay on, I was only able to cut a few mintues at a time. The older version seemed to be a much higher quality..
customer_reviews.author: SCBFSU

customer_reviews.title: Good power
customer_reviews.text: I just used my new saw for the first time today, it worked good! My only complaint really even isn't a complaint, but its fairly heavy to handle, which is good, because its well built, but the balance, and where the handle is for your second hand is worthless. I'm not a weakling, but this saw is a handful.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little saw!
customer_reviews.text: This Remington 10" saw took down 3 good size trees - you can see the last of the three in the photo. Used the pole to cut back those over the roof. Got everything up to about 12 inches in diameter. Will rent a big saw to tackle the remaining trunks. The chain that came with it took on the first two trees and used a new one for the last tree. The OEM chain does stretch more than the replacement, and it did finally stretch more than could work. They're only 10 bucks at HD. Sure beats holding a 20 pound gas saw 20 feet in the air!
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Neal

customer_reviews.title: Remington pole-saw
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be of good quality. Solid, sturdy. However, it is very heavy for a pole-saw. Minor trimming of high-up branches is OK. Several trees/branches, not likely. Simply too heavy to hold upright for extended periods of time. My Homelite pole-saw lasted 10yrs+ and is about half the weight of this new saw I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done and we will be using it again.
customer_reviews.text: This saw works great, however, it is heavy to hold up in the extended length. We are in our mid-sixties and he has had some health problem. But with my help, we were able to lift it in the air, guide it to them limb. Once there and positioned, it did the rest of the work, but once it got through the limb, I would step forward to “catch it” on its way down. We cut several limbs this way and were satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Connie T.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with it. Highly recommend. It is heavy at full extension but to be sturdy and powerful enough it is what it is. No problems with chain or oil leaking.
customer_reviews.author: robert cook

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - Chain Issues after 3 cuts
customer_reviews.text: Despite tightening the chain, the chain fell of after 3 cuts. The internal plastic sprocket kit broke, and I had to order a new one. Update. I purchased the replacement part. It does fix the problem. I've been on hold with customer service for over an hour. Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Frausto

customer_reviews.title: cuts great, easy to handle but used half the reservoir ...
customer_reviews.text: possibly defective, cuts great, easy to handle but used half the reservoir of oil first time, went to use it a second time and all the oil had leaked out. Buy the warranty! Called customer service and was told not to put so much oil in it. Only put in what you think you need, it's going to leak out.
customer_reviews.author: RUDY

customer_reviews.title: Good Product At A Good Price, But Takes A Real Man To Wield!
customer_reviews.text: The price and quality of this item was very good. Versatility was a real plus as well. The only issue I have is that it is a very heavy item and is not easy to wield. With the saw at the end of the extended pole, you have to have a lot of upper arm and shoulder strength to use it. Don't recommend it for wussies!
customer_reviews.author: BillyTheG

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted, and no surprises. The item shipped when promised, easy assembly and works as advertised. The only possible thing to consider is that the saw is a bit heavy when fully extended and working overhead. Otherwise all good.
customer_reviews.author: Luap

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw for the price
customer_reviews.text: Chainsaw is heavy(4 stars for that reason) compared to my old 10" poulan but does the job. I like that its easy to switch between the chainsaw & pole saw. Doesn't leak bar oil( for now ). I will update over time.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Paid for first day!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool. Pretty much ready to use right out of the box. It’s great for trimming branches that were unreachable before. It paid for itself first day. Had one of my trees that needed trimming badly bid on by local tree company at $200. I had tree trimmed in about half an hour. Easy to use. It is a little top heavy when fully extended but I use that weight to help cut through the branch without having to use any force at all. I read other reviews before buying about having problems with the chain. I have zero problems with the chain. Easy to use chain tension knob is key.
customer_reviews.author: TerryB

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and awkward
customer_reviews.text: The saw and parts are built very well but extremely unbalanced and top heay when fully extended ; also trigger was stuck initially ; took 15 mins to work free and the oil cap had a hole in it ; it went back next day ; the search continues for a safe light weight pole saw
customer_reviews.author: Nordog

customer_reviews.title: terrible packing
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived in its manufacturer's box, not nearly heavy for shipping purposes. The box had been broken open on one end and taped shut and the entire box was mangled. I am not going to take a chance on the saw working after this shipping fiasco. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Neuman

customer_reviews.title: Improved over previos versions
customer_reviews.text: I owned an older version of this model that finally died. I like some of the small improvements in design such as the bar chain oil reservoir and hook for the power cord. The weight feels slightly heavier than the older version but also more durable. It makes short work of pruning work from small to midsize limbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend. Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love it. so much better than my old one. Love the angle of bar. The weight is heavy which I think is good because it helps for bar to go through branch
customer_reviews.author: shawn moran

customer_reviews.title: Great but check tension frequently
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw but it has one little issue. The chain become loose rather quickly, much more than a conventional chain saw. So, just check the tension every couple of cuts and you won't have a problem. Watch the video and see how easy it is to adjust the tension - takes only a couple of seconds.
customer_reviews.author: PositiveMojo

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, well made but it leaks oil while it is sitting in storage.
customer_reviews.author: BGWENGG

customer_reviews.title: Previously Opened???
customer_reviews.text: I hope the item works and works. well. This was not sold as previously owned or returned. All of the plastic, items, and instructions have been opened before. When you purchase NEW, you expect it to be new, not returned and resold without letting customers know. Not okay.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Green

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it but it is heavy when fully extended.
customer_reviews.text: I like the saw. It is easy to covert from the chain saw to the pole saw. However, the pole saw is heavy and somewhat difficult to use when fully extended. If it came with a shoulder strap I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like Hell
customer_reviews.text: Leaks oil like crazy. Better invest in a oil well. When you do have it filled up it cuts really good. Can not send back due to oil leaks,
customer_reviews.author: Jim Renault

customer_reviews.title: What’s a little oil?
customer_reviews.text: Ok, for the money this saw is nice. As per reviews on this saw and others the jab was it leaks bar oil like a sieve. Well, it does seem to leak. I left it on my bench and had to clean up a puddle of oil, so for hanging storage I didn’t want that. However, it hold such a small amount of oil that I just drain it back into the quart bottle! Done deal!
customer_reviews.author: Gail E. Southard

customer_reviews.title: Tough little saw...
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is tough!, after "Florence" I had a lot of wood to cut and this little baby tore through branches much bigger than the suggested size. Made clean-up much easier. Using the extension is not easy or very effective, but for everything else it's great. Would have given it 5 stars if not for the extension bar. I'd definitely buy it again and recommend to others. You can't go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions about the chain oil and chain adjustments
customer_reviews.text: Found this overall to be a great product. Be sure to add the chain oil and expect to make adjustments to tighten the chain as noted in the directions after the first few cuts. I found it heavy when the pole is fully extended to trim higher branches, holding the weight of the saw overhead. Seems to leak the chain oil and have to keep an eye on the level so plan to get that oil on your clothes and hands/work gloves when using.
customer_reviews.author: Trish O

customer_reviews.title: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and love the way can be separated to use the saw without the pole. Only issue would have it's very heavy extended way out. Expected that with saw head on end of pole but not as much as experienced. Good value
customer_reviews.author: redusc

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice saw that is easy to use. A little heavy when the pole is extended, but, as long as you are careful, it works really well. Trimmed branches quickly. My sons-in-law had a blast using it!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall King

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for father's day for my husband. He uses it a lot and says it works great. He is able to gut limbs to small for a chainsaw to big for a hand saw. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dionne Coburn

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly solid built. Yes slightly heavier than I would expect but then, it’s a tool on the pole. Longer extended heavier it is. Properly applied Weight actually helps during process. So other people complains are unacceptable here. :). Does a good job. Lowe’s has exact the same item prized almost as twice as.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy D. Kasvin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Cut great. Chain comes off if using by not tightening after the fist couple of cuts. Other wise am happy with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: This was not for us and seemed a little too heavy for the wife and the chain kept coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good polesaw
customer_reviews.text: Let's face it, it's heavier than I expected it to be when fully extended but thats just the law of physics. It cuts really well and has great power. I felt like SpongeBob in the weightlifting competition🤗
customer_reviews.author: Linda Stockton

customer_reviews.title: works well but if I had to do it all ...
customer_reviews.text: works well but if I had to do it all over again, I would purchase one that was battery operated vs corded. would make the work a lot easier for this type of tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: This thing works
customer_reviews.text: Man these saws are awesome. After issuing a neighbors I order one of my own.Does not come with chain oil!! Needs to be bigger on the box. Very simple assembly. However my 60 y/o dad has a hard time keeping the chain on even after adjustments. This thing really gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best pole saw in its class
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the option of using like a standard pole saw or using as a standard chain saw. Very solidly made saw. Can be a little heavy when pole is adjusted to its full extension
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Awkward tool
customer_reviews.text: A heavy saw at the end of a long pole is not practical. A ladder and buck saw are safer.
customer_reviews.author: John Z

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it as long as you can wield it.
customer_reviews.text: So far this works well. Cuts great and it converts between configurations very easily. When it is in pole saw configuration it is quite heavy and I wouldn’t suggest it for someone who would physically have difficulty moving a heavy weight on the end of a long stick safely. If were not for it being able to convert to a chainsaw I would opt for something lighter but I like the multi tool aspect and so far it cuts great. Well worth it as long as you can wield it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Seay

customer_reviews.title: Makes Tree Trimming Fun
customer_reviews.text: This "saw on a stick" makes short work of low branches. Much easier then the old hand saw on a stick. You can get more done in less time. Shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: EagleI

customer_reviews.title: Nice Backyard Tool
customer_reviews.text: Like the features and auto oilier. Great to be able to use as a small electric chainsaw too. So far, I'm pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ice

customer_reviews.title: heavy but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: useful and wonderful. somewhat heavy for a woman like me even if I am tall and strong. makes the job much easier than the regular one without a saw. a lifesaver and a money saver too!
customer_reviews.author: Edna Johnston

product_meta.title: Remington RM1035P Ranger II 8-Amp Electric 2-in-1 Pole Saw & Chainsaw with with Telescoping Shaft and 10-Inch Bar for Tree Trimming and Pruning, Orange
product_meta.description: Style:2019 MODELWhen you need to go that extra mile, Remington has you covered. Taking down hard-to-reach branches is one of the most important parts of yard maintenance. This 2-in-1 pole saw/chainsaw features a full wrap handle allowing for more maneuverability and versatility while cutting. And because the cord and handguard are always at the bottom of the pole, there are fewer snag hazards when you’re in pole saw mode. That’s good when you’re trimming branches up above your head. It also features a push-button quick change that allows you to convert to a chainsaw easily, without tools, so you can cut up those downed branches in no time.
feature_bullets: ADJUSTABLE: A telescoping design paired with flip and lock clamps allows the operator to quickly adjust the length of the pole saw so that trimming trees of varying heights isn’t a hassle
2-IN-1 FUNCTIONALITY: Logs on the ground? Simply detach the saw from the pole to convert the unit from a pole saw into a chainsaw No tools required!

LONG REACH: Designed with a shaft extendable up to 10-feet for high branches With operator height considered, the pole saw can cut limbs 10-feet to 15-feet overhead making those previously hard-to-reach places easy-to-reach

ELECTRIC POWERED: An 8-amp electric motor instantly starts to drive the chain over the low-kickback 10-inch bar and chain Get to work right away on your lawn care, trimming, yard work, and other projects
PRUNE IN COMFORT: Chainsaw has non-slip grip to enhance comfort and an Anti-rotation pole for stability during use Maintain optimal comfortability, comfort, and command
IMPORTANT NOTE: Bar and chain oil may seep from unit when not in use Remember to loosen the saw chain with the tool-free tensioner if it was adjusted during operation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars514 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
